Text saved: It is common to see small animals like birds, squirrels, mice and insects in many cities and towns. But in recent years, the news has been full of stories about wild animals coming into cities more and more. For example, there have been bears in Vancouver parks, leopards on the streets of Mumbai and wild pigs in gardens in Berlin. What happens when bigger animals come into our cities? Are they welcome, or are they seen as a danger or a problem?
